title: "We now intend to rebuild the item set creator tool"
body:
**"We now intend to rebuild the item set creator tool"**

This is important, don't let this change go uncelebrated guys. I was really pissed off when they said they weren't doing Item Set again, gave up on clunky 3rd Parties that couldn't match the integration and ease of use

Don't forget Replays
Don't forget Voice Coms*
Don't forget Item Sets
And don't forget that Riot DOES listen and change their minds to suit their players

Thank you Mark Hamil and the rest at Riot for listening and compromising

*Riot said people may as well use 3rd Party for voice comms, but they said the same thing about Item Sets, and a lot more people use Voice Coms. It can very well happen these days

tutorial on how to use the shop:

1- click the recommended items page on the left
2- click whatever item has the component you want on the left (ex: you want boots, you click the ionian boots)
3- now look at the right page of the shop, the selected item shows all the components and upgrades related to said item
4- buy boots of choices

5- repeat for every single item in the game
6- do the above in 2-3 seconds or 2-3 clicks every time you recall

(this assumes you know what components build into what item of course)

not saying it's wrong, simply pointing out you can buy all the items in the game from riot recommended items pages usually in a couple clicks (or at least as many clicks as what ppl suggest with their personal item sets page)

there are a couple exceptions where your method or other personal item sets would be better, like a few recommended items pages lack boots for example haha, so you have to dig them on the -show all item available- page, and some other exceptions where you play a champion in a way that isn't intended, like AP ashe.
Or you could make an item set and pick up every item you use in 1 click or 1 second. :P

but then you are back to the default -all items available- page style that includes all components + common and situational items fully completed and you spend 5+ seconds scrolling up and down through the giant list every time

I know that's what I did at first ;o like everyone else I used the item sets before realizing it was not useful and I was wasting my time

*laughs in actually knowing how to use Item Sets effectively*

Nothing about putting the 20 or so items you use most on one page makes any other aspect of using the shop any slower, all it does is puts 99% of the items you will buy in easy reach of your cursor. It sounds like you just need to git gud ;O

K,

if you want to buy everything you could want in one single click only on akali for example your item set would need (I just checked in game to be sure + I have 100K mastery on akali):

~ 30 components or tier 1 items (this includes potions, trinkets, elixirs and starting items that don't upgrade into anything

~ 35 tier 2 items (stuff that uses 1 component or more but are not final items)

~ 35 final items (this includes all boots 2)

That's ~100 items on your item page. That's maybe twice or three times the shop user interface, you are not only going to scroll up and down a lot, but even locating the right item on the list is going to take several seconds every time. You aren't gaining any time, and you also had to make the page in the first place, and you are doing it for all the champions you own.

If you are only adding the final items, then you have to use the right page of the shop like I explained above to buy components and tier 2 items from those final items, thus clicking just as much as you would without it.

You don't need to put components in your item set lmao

I think we're both understating the number of clicks required to do these things.

> 1- click the recommended items page on the left
> 2- click whatever item has the component you want on the left (ex: you want boots, you click the ionian boots)
> 3- now look at the right page of the shop, the selected item shows all the components and upgrades related to said item
> 4- buy boots of choices

Using this way, you must CLICK (1) on a final item that has your desired component, CLICK (2) on the desired component, CLICK (3) on the item that the component builds into (since you're not going to leave an incomplete item in your build, which means you're going to have to do this eventually), and then sometimes CLICK (4) on a different component for that item (if I click on Black Cleaver to click on Kindlegem to get to Spirit Visage to buy a Spectre's Cowl, for example, because I'm building Spirit Visage and I need the Magic Resist Component).

That's 3-4 clicks to buy your first component, one click to buy further components for the same item or complete the item, and 3-4 additional clicks every time you switch which item you're building. If you buy a component for an item (3 clicks), buy Boots of Speed (2 clicks), buy another component to your item (3 clicks), complete your item (1 click), then buy tier 2 Boots of your choice (3 clicks) that's 12 clicks.

Using an item set where you  have all your final items, you CLICK (1) on the final item you are building and then CLICK (2) on the component you want to buy.

That's 2 clicks to buy your first component, one click to buy further components for the same item or complete the item, and 2 additional clicks every time you switch which item you're building. If you buy a component for an item (2 clicks), buy Boots of Speed (2 clicks), buy another component for your item (2 clicks), then complete the item (1 click), then buy tier 2 Boots of your choice (1 click because it's a final item in your item set), that's 8 clicks.

You shave off 33% of the time it takes to buy your first item and tier 2 Boots by having an item set prepared.
you can click an item you already have in your inventory, it will show all the upgrades/components on the right page of the screen, you don't have to repeat everything every time.
I do
My thought. I used it for like my first 6 months. Itemizing isn't hard. Not a fan of riot implementing crutches like this.

It's not a crutch. It's convenient.

You'd have to be braindead to create an item set with one build and follow it to the letter every game. Not even lazy, because a lazy person wouldn't go through the trouble of making an item set in the first place. You can incorporate forward thinking when you're making an item set without any trouble, and nothing stops you from building items that aren't in your set anyways.
Item sets are for people who don't want to have to search for every item they think of buying when they could just have them be on their front shop page, and I for one am happy they're coming back

When I make Item sets, Ill put items in that I would use in any game scenario. Udyr for example I would put any jg items I use in one category (red smite/ blue smite with warriors/bloodrazor/cinderhulk) and other categories like MR, Armor, Health, AD, AP etc. It saved a lot of time I would normally spend in shop searching for what I need and would sometimes take up ~10 seconds. Having the item sets made it more visually easy for me to find what I need, therefore less shop downtime. Also I kinda have this mistake of buying a Dorans blade when playing Yasuo jungle sometimes which is why I'm happy that Riot is bringing it back.(but i think that might just be me being boosted) ( Í¡Â° ÍÊ Í¡Â°)
